fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces

Interface SimulatorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SimulationManagementI, VariableInitialisationI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AtomicSimulatorI, CoordinatorI, RTAtomicSimulatorI, RTSimulatorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AtomicEngine, AtomicRTEngine, CoordinationEngine, CoordinationRTEngine, SimulationEngine

    public interface SimulatorI
extends SimulationManagementI, VariableInitialisationI
    The interface SimulationI declares the core behaviour of DEVS simulation engines.

    Description

    TODO

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       isModelSet() == (getSimulatedModel() != null)
 invariant       !isModelSet() || !isSimulationInitialised() || getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(getTimeOfLastEvent().getTimeUnit())
 invariant       !isModelSet() || !isSimulationInitialised() || getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().getTimeUnit())
 invariant       !isModelSet() || !isSimulationInitialised() || getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(getNextTimeAdvance().getTimeUnit())
 invariant       !isModelSet() || !isSimulationInitialised() || getSimulationEndTime().greaterThan(getTimeOfStart())

    Created on : 2016-02-04

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean blackBoxInvariants(SimulatorI instance)
      return true if the black-box invariants are observed, false otherwise.
      default void confluentEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event or an internal event at the given simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the simulated time clock at the time of the call; when more than on event can be executed, only one is chosen and executed.
      void endSimulation(Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation, doing the necessary catering tasks.
      void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.
      Duration getNextTimeAdvance()
      return the duration until the next internal event as previously computed by timeAdvance().
      ModelI getSimulatedModel()
      return the model simulated by this simulation engine or null if not set yet.
      Time getTimeOfLastEvent()
      return the time of occurrence of the last event.
      Time getTimeOfNextEvent()
      return the currently forecast time of occurrence of the next event.
      boolean hasDebugLevel(int debugLevel)
      true if the current debug level is equal to debugLevel, false otherwise.
      void initialiseSimulation(Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to 0; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void initialiseSimulation(Time simulationStartTime, Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void internalEventStep()
      process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.
      boolean isDebugModeOn()
      return true if the debug level is greater than 0.
      boolean isLoggerSet()
      return true if the logger is set, false otherwise.
      boolean isModelSet()
      return true if the simulator has been given its model to be simulated.
      boolean isParentSet()
      return true if the parent simulation engine of this engine is set.
      default boolean isRealTime()
      return true if the simulator is a real time simulator.
      boolean isSimulationInitialised()
      return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.
      void logMessage(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String message)
      log a message through the logger or do nothing if no logger is set.
      java.lang.String modelAsString(java.lang.String indent)
      return the model information as a string.
      void produceOutput(Time current)
      force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.
      void setDebugLevel(int newDebugLevel)
      set the debug level.
      void setLogger(MessageLoggingI logger)
      set the logger of this model i.e. an object through which logging can be done during simulation runs.
      void setParent(CoordinatorI c)
      set the parent simulation engine of this engine to c.
      void setSimulatedModel(ModelI simulatedModel)
      associate the provided simulation model with the simulation engine.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the current state.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the content of the current state, without pre- and post-formatting.
      java.lang.String simulatorAsString()
      return the simulator information as a string.
      void toggleDebugMode()
      activate the lowest debug level or deactivate the debug mode completely.

         pre     instance != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        instance - instance to be tested.
        Returns:

      • initialiseSimulation

        void initialiseSimulation(Duration simulationDuration)
        initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to 0; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.

        Contract

         pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     simulationDuration != null
 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    !this.getSimulatedModel().isRoot() || isSimulationInitialised()
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Parameters:
        simulationDuration - duration of the simulation to be launched.

      • initialiseSimulation

        void initialiseSimulation(Time simulationStartTime,
                          Duration simulationDuration)
        initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.

        Contract

         pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     simulationStartTime != null
 pre     simulationStartTime.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationStartTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())) 
 pre     simulationDuration != null
 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedModel().getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    !this.getSimulatedModel().isRoot() || isSimulationInitialised()
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Parameters:
        simulationStartTime - time at which the simulation must start.
        simulationDuration - duration of the simulation to be launched.

      • isSimulationInitialised

        boolean isSimulationInitialised()
        return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if the simulation has been initialised.

      • internalEventStep

        void internalEventStep()
        process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))

      • externalEventStep

        void externalEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
        process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.

        The processing first cancel the previously forecast internal event if any and then make the transition to a new model state given the processed external event and then forecast a new internal event.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time elapsed since the last event executed by this engine.

      • confluentEventStep

        default void confluentEventStep(Duration elapsedTime)
        process an external input event or an internal event at the given simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the simulated time clock at the time of the call; when more than on event can be executed, only one is chosen and executed.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time elapsed since the last event executed by this engine.

      • produceOutput

        void produceOutput(Time current)
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" of DEVS i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing through their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
